Posted By: Discoduck (10/1/2012 4:11:12 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
I actually like this card (only for limited, though).   
  
Remember [Skirsdag Flayer](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Skirsdag Flayer)? Do you remember people blocking your biggy, then saccing the blocker to kill another attacker?   
  
Well, that's this, except you can sac any creature, and they lose life...   
  
But you can only do this once...  
  
Well, I'm still giving it 3 stars. Not bad, especially for limited.
posts.html:

Well, I'm still giving it 3 stars. Not bad, especially for limited.

posts.post_content:
I hope Wizards doesn't see the low rating and decide this card was a failure. This card is *awesome.* And it's a pretty good introduction to the Rakdos mindset.  
  
Sure, a subpar 2.0 rating is probably about what it deserves on the power scale, but I can live with a few underpowered cards, when they contribute a lot to the set's flavor. Life's too short to not love the things they do. :)

Posted By: Goatllama (12/10/2012 6:44:09 AM)
Rating:

posts.post_content: Decent card in limited. Stab wound is an actual card (i've lost and won with this card), and it's nice to have a sac effect to get rid of it. When you consider that jarad and the golgari guildmage are both premium cards likely to be taken early, this is one of the few ways to reliably get rid of a stab wounded creature. Arrest and paralyzing grasp are also in the set, things that you don't mind saccing creatures from. IIRC it's also the only unconditional instant speed removal (ignoring the fact that you need to sac something).
posts.html:

Posted By: lorendorky (10/24/2012 11:38:34 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
This thing has given me crazy mileage in limited.  
  
Yeah, you're 2-for-1-ing yourself. But it's only a matter of time before you've got a creature that's no longer useful to you. Especially in a limited environment with Detain, [Arrest](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Arrest), [Paralyzing Grasp](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Paralyzing Grasp), and [Stab Wound](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Stab Wound). And sometimes, all I need is those 2 points of life to end the game.  
  
You have to use it at the right time, but that just makes a card more satisfying.
posts.html:

You have to use it at the right time, but that just makes a card more satisfying.
